intro: Ardisia guadeloupensis var. genuina, commonly known as the Guadeloupe ardisia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
